title: Apply AABoxes pink background on all non-Home routes

requirements.summary: Sample the primary pink from image-12.png and add a single reusable theme token for it in the styling system.
acceptanceCriteria: A single canonical "AABoxes pink" color token exists in the frontend styling system.
The chosen pink is sampled from image-12.png (not manually substituted with an unrelated pink).

file_operations.description: Add a canonical CSS custom property token (e.g., --aaboxes-pink) under :root (and ensure itâ€™s available regardless of dark mode). The value must be sampled directly from the uploaded image-12.png using a color picker/eyedropper, then stored as the single source-of-truth token.
Expose the AABoxes pink token as a Tailwind color (e.g., aaboxesPink mapped to the CSS variable) so it can be applied consistently via utility classes across pages.

requirements.summary: Apply the AABoxes pink background on every route except Home ('/'), ensuring admin routes do not show black backgrounds.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting '/' (Home) keeps the current background styling (no forced pink page background applied globally).
Visiting '/admin/login' uses the extracted AABoxes pink as the page background (no black background visible).
Visiting '/admin' uses the extracted AABoxes pink as the page background (no black background visible).
No route shows an unintended black background as a result of this change.

file_operations.description: Update the root layout to conditionally apply the AABoxes pink background on all non-Home routes based on the current pathname while leaving '/' unchanged. Ensure the wrapper sets a full-page background (min height) so underlying black is never visible.

Remove/adjust page-level background classes (including dark gradients) so the page inherits the non-Home route background from the root layout token, ensuring no black background appears on '/admin/login'.
Remove/adjust page-level background classes (including dark gradients) so the page inherits the non-Home route background from the root layout token, ensuring no black background appears on '/admin'.
